t: For the choir director; on a stringed instrument. A Psalm of David.
Hear*pn my cry, O God; Give*ln heed to my prayer.
From*ln the end of the earth I call to You when my heart is faint; Lead*ln me to the rock that is higher than I.
For*ln You have been a refuge for me, A*ln tower of strength against the enemy.
Let*ln me dwell in Your tent forever; Let*ln me take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah.
For*ln You have heard my vows, O God; You*ln have given me*i the inheritance of those who fear Your name.
You*ln will prolong the king’s life; His*ln years will be as many generations.
He*ln will abide before God forever; Appoint*ln lovingkindness and truth that they may preserve him.
So*ln I will sing praise to Your name forever, That*ln I may pay my vows day by day.
